attributes.action: support our campaign to keep Heaton Avenue First and Nursery school as a community primary school at the heart of the community.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Heaton Avenue First and Nursery School has a reputation for ‘outstanding teaching and learning’ (OFSTED, 2008). Kirklees reorganisation proposals threaten the existence of the school and all it stands for. 
We reject the council’s proposal to close the school. Closure would reduce parental choice in an increasingly diverse community and would force many local children to travel across town to school.
We also reject the council’s proposal for a smaller primary of 210 pupils at West End. Such a plan would severely impact on funding, on staff numbers and on the of delivery excellent teaching and learning. It is a recipe for underachievement.
Instead we support the governing body’s alternative proposals: a 1.5 form entry, 315-pupil community primary school plus nursery. It will ensure outstanding provision for local children and will provide facilities befitting a 21st century school.
Most of all, it will best serve the community by putting a school at the heart of that community.
